name: HTML
description: Hands-on HTML coding problem statements to strengthen structure, semantics, accessibility, and layout skills.

topics.name: Basic Structure
questions: Create a basic HTML5 document with proper doctype, head, and body.
Build a simple webpage with a header, main section, and footer.
Create a personal profile page using only semantic HTML tags.
Design a webpage layout using header, nav, section, article, aside, and footer.
Create an HTML page that displays a heading hierarchy from h1 to h6 correctly.

topics.name: Text & Formatting
questions: Create a webpage demonstrating bold, italic, underline, and emphasized text.
Build an article page with paragraphs, line breaks, and horizontal rules.
Display a quotation using blockquote and cite tags.
Create a page showing ordered, unordered, and description lists.
Design a FAQ section using headings and paragraphs only.

topics.name: Links & Navigation
questions: Create a navigation bar using anchor tags.
Build a multi-page website with internal links between pages.
Create external links that open in a new tab.
Add anchor links to jump to different sections of the same page.
Create an email and phone link using anchor tags.

topics.name: Images & Media
questions: Create an image gallery using img tags.
Add alt text to images to improve accessibility.
Embed an audio file with playback controls.
Embed a video file with autoplay and muted attributes.
Use the picture element to display different images for different screen sizes.

topics.name: Forms
questions: Create a basic contact form with name, email, and message fields.
Build a registration form using text, password, radio, and checkbox inputs.
Create a login form with proper labels and placeholders.
Design a feedback form with textarea and select dropdown.
Create a form that validates required fields using HTML attributes.

topics.name: Tables
questions: Create a student marks table using table, tr, th, and td.
Merge table cells using rowspan and colspan.
Build a timetable using an HTML table.
Create a comparison table with a table header and table footer.
Make a table accessible using caption, thead, tbody, and tfoot.

topics.name: Semantic HTML
questions: Build a blog page using article, section, header, and footer.
Create a news website layout using semantic tags only.
Design a product page using figure and figcaption.
Convert a div-based layout into a semantic HTML layout.
Create an accessible webpage using proper landmarks and headings.

topics.name: Mini Projects (HTML Only)
questions: Build a resume using only HTML.
Create a simple landing page structure using semantic HTML.
Design a static portfolio website using HTML only.
Build a restaurant menu page using lists and tables.
Create a documentation-style page using headings, sections, and links.
